title: The Last Letter from Larkspur
premise: A decade after a bitter breakup, a celebrated but reclusive epistolary novelist discovers her ex-fiancé has been anonymously writing her fan letters for years. When a literary event forces them together, they must navigate the curated personas they've built and the unfinished story they left behind, one painfully honest letter at a time.
protagonist: Elara Vance, a bestselling author who hides from the world behind her words.
conflict: Elara must decide if the man she once loved—and who has been secretly connecting with her through her work—is the same person who broke her heart, or if their second chance lies in the vulnerable, unwritten pages between the lines of their past.
setting: Present-day in the secluded, misty literary haven of Port Townsend, Washington, and through flashbacks to their college years in Oxford.
tone: Atmospheric, introspective, and yearning, with a deep undercurrent of intellectual and emotional intimacy.
